com.bigdata.service.geospatial

Interface IGeoSpatialQuery

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GeoSpatialQuery

    public interface IGeoSpatialQuery
    Interface representing (the configuration of) a geospatial query. See also GeoSpatial for the vocabulary that can be used to define such a query as SERVICE (or inline).
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    Michael Schmidt

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  IGeoSpatialQuery.LowerAndUpperBound
      Helper class encapsulating both the lower and upper bound as implied by the query, for the given datatype configuration.
      static class  IGeoSpatialQuery.LowerAndUpperValue

      • getLowerAndUpperBound

        IGeoSpatialQuery.LowerAndUpperBound getLowerAndUpperBound()
        Returns:
        a structure containing the lower and upper bound component object defined by this query

      • normalize

        List<IGeoSpatialQuery> normalize()
        Normalizes a GeoSpatial query by converting it into an list of GeoSpatial queries that are normalized, see isNormalized(). The list of queries may be empty if the given query contains unsatisfiable range restrictions (e.g., a timestamp or longitude range from [9;8]. However, note that a latitude range from [10;0] will be interpreted as "everything not in the interval ]0;10[.

      • isNormalized

        boolean isNormalized()
        Returns:
        true if the query is normalized. See

      • isSatisfiable

        boolean isSatisfiable()
        Returns:
        true if the query is satisfiable

      • getDatatypeConfig

        GeoSpatialDatatypeConfiguration getDatatypeConfig()
        Returns:
        the datatype configuration associated with the query
